snippet: A piece of art that might be one of Jackson Pollock’s acclaimed drip paintings brings together an unlikely couple in “Bakersfield Mist,” presented by the New Jersey Repertory Company.
abstract: Anita Gates reviews New Jersey Repertory Company production of Stephen Sachs play Bakersfield Mist, directed by SuzAnne Barabas and starring Linda S Nelson and John FitzGibbon; production is part of rolling world premiere (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: A piece of art that might be one of Jackson Pollock’s acclaimed drip paintings brings together an unlikely couple in “Bakersfield Mist,” presented by the New Jersey Repertory Company.

headline.seo: New Jersey Repertory Company’s ‘Bakersfield Mist’ — Review
headline.main: A Painting and a Bond of Questionable Authenticity
headline.print_headline: A Painting and a Bond of Questionable Authenticity
